forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 3pm. Cloudy, with a high near 48. Southwest wind 12 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely before 3am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 32. Southwest wind 13 to 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Boston, a gentle veil of clouds stretches across the skyline, hinting at the promise of rain later in the day. The air is cool and crisp, holding the unmistakable bite of December, with temperatures hovering close to the mid-forties. Though the morning has yet to unveil any significant sunshine, the movement of the southwest winds whispers through the trees, rustling leaves and bringing an ever-present chill. The chance of rain looms, casting a gray pall over the city, yet today holds a character of its own—mellow and introspective.

As the hours slip by toward afternoon, residents can anticipate a damp shift in the weather, with rain likely to grace the area before the night settles in. It might be wise to don a sturdy jacket, perhaps layered with a cozy sweater, along with a reliable pair of boots, prepared for the possibility of splashes from puddles forming beneath a drizzling sky. While the clouds may obscure brilliant vistas, the essence of the city remains alive; one might meander through the quaint storefronts of a local neighborhood or seek solace in a favorite café, sipping a warm beverage while watching the world drift by. It may not be a day for grand outdoor adventures, but rather an opportunity to embrace the cozy comforts of indoor spaces and quiet reflections on the beauty of a muted, rainy day.
